## Resources

* git/GitHub in R  
  - [Lisa's GitHub for colaboration](https://github.com/llendway/github_for_collaboration/blob/master/github_for_collaboration.md)
  - [Happy git with R](https://happygitwithr.com/)
  - [R Packages - making a PR](https://r-pkgs.org/git.html#git-pullreq)
  
* Building a website  
  - [Sharing on Short Notice](https://rstudio.com/resources/webinars/sharing-on-short-notice-how-to-get-your-materials-online-with-r-markdown/) with Alison Hill and DesirÃ©e De Leon from R Studio
  - [Lisa's Building a distill website blog post](https://lisalendway.netlify.app/posts/2020-12-09-buildingdistill/)  
  - [Tom Mock's distill post](https://themockup.blog/posts/2020-08-01-building-a-blog-with-distill/)
  - [Emily Zabor's tutorial](https://www.emilyzabor.com/tutorials/rmarkdown_websites_tutorial.html)  
  - [blogdown site](https://bookdown.org/yihui/blogdown/) and check out recent updates [here](https://blog.rstudio.com/2021/01/18/blogdown-v1.0/)
  
* Building an R package  
  - [Lisa's example of building a data package](https://lisalendway.netlify.app/posts/2020-12-30-welcometothejungle/) 
  - [Tom Westlake's Writing an R Package From Scratch ](https://r-mageddon.netlify.app/post/writing-an-r-package-from-scratch/)  
  - [R package book](https://r-pkgs.org/)
  
* Shiny
  - [Lisa's intro to building a shiny app](https://animation-and-interactivity-in-r.netlify.app/#creating-an-app-with-shiny)  
  - [R Studio tutorials](https://shiny.rstudio.com/tutorial/) 
  - [Styling Shiny and R markdown](https://youtu.be/4OxokLdZQgQ) with Carson Sievert from R Studio
  
* Tidymodels
  - [tidymodels.org main page](https://www.tidymodels.org/)
  - [Tidy Models with R textbook](https://www.tmwr.org/)
  - [Lisa's tidymodels noRth presentation](https://youtu.be/tVZO-aoXStE)
  - [Julia Silge's blog with great examples](https://juliasilge.com/)
  
* Model stacking / ensembles  
  - [stacks R package documentation](https://stacks.tidymodels.org/articles/basics.html)
  - [Hands on Machine Learning](https://bradleyboehmke.github.io/HOML/stacking.html)
  
* Model interpretation
  - [DALExtra R package](https://modeloriented.github.io/DALEXtra/reference/explain_tidymodels.html)
  - [lime R package](https://uc-r.github.io/lime)
  - [Interpretable Machine Learning](https://christophm.github.io/interpretable-ml-book/)
  - [Explanatory Model Analysis](http://ema.drwhy.ai/)
  - [Hands on Machine Learning](https://bradleyboehmke.github.io/HOML/iml.html)
  
* Data ethics / justice
  - [fast.ai ethics course](https://ethics.fast.ai/videos/?lesson=1)
  - [Data Justice intro](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/2053951717736335#:~:text=This%20paper%20posits%20that%20just,paths%20through%20a%20datafying%20world.)  
  - [Prediction-Based Decisions and Fairness](https://arxiv.org/abs/1811.07867)

* Using databases with R / SQL
  - [Vebash Naidoo's blog posts](https://sciencificity-blog.netlify.app/posts/2020-12-12-using-the-tidyverse-with-databases/)  
  - [Dr. Simona Picardi's course material](https://ecorepsci.github.io/reproducible-science/rsqlite.html) from  WILD 6900: Tools for Reproducible Science, Spring 2021, Utah State University
  
* Gradient boosted machines (GBM) and H20
  - [Hands on Machine Learning](https://bradleyboehmke.github.io/HOML/gbm.html)
  - [H20 documentation](https://docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/welcome.html)
  - [H20 booklet](https://www.h2o.ai/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/RBooklet.pdf)
  
* Deep Learning
  - [Deep Learning with R](https://www.manning.com/books/deep-learning-with-r#toc)
  - [Hands on Machine Learning](https://bradleyboehmke.github.io/HOML/deep-learning.html)
